actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

official_title: A bill to clarify the authority of the Federal Communications Commission under the Communications Act of 1934.

summary.text: Cellular Communication Competition Act - Amends the Communications Act of 1934 to prohibit the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) from approving the assignment or transfer of control of a nonwireline cellular license in one of the nation's ten largest cities to a wireless telephone provider, or subsidiary thereof, unless it finds that such assignment or transfer does not reduce competition in cellular services and is otherwise in the public interest, convenience, and necessity. Outlines factors to be considered by the FCC in making such findings.

titles.title: A bill to clarify the authority of the Federal Communications Commission under the Communications Act of 1934.
